texts.definition: A God's Finger is a game element that allows the player to affect the game world, but which cannot be affected by events in the game world itself.
examples: many real-time strategy games make use of a [God's Finger](god-finger) in the form of a cursor that is used to select individual units or groups. Similarly, the "Sims" makes use of a cursor to let players move between the different characters in the game and to manipulate the game world.
the cursor in god-game "Black & White" is literally a [God's Finger](god-finger).
usage: The simplest use of a [God's Finger](god-finger) is to let players navigate the [Game World](game-world) to select the [Units](units) they wish to use. However, a [God's Finger](god-finger) can act as a [Focus Loci](focus-loci) for actions that are independent of [Units](units) or to specify the effect areas of ranged actions, for example, by selecting an area by stating its boundaries. Often the [God's Finger](god-finger) is outside the [Consistent Reality Logic](consistent-reality-logic) of the game but exceptions are possible, e. g. through using spirits and possessions.
consequences: A [God's Finger](god-finger) lets the players navigate the game world regardless of where their [Avatars](avatars) and [Units](units) are. By doing so, they may limit the use of [Surprises](surprises) and the feeling of [Immersion](immersion) as the [God's Finger](god-finger) does not typically provide a point of identificationfor the player and is outside the [Consistent Reality Logic](consistent-reality-logic) of the game.
